title: Do 80% of Nigerians lack safe drinking water? It’s worse than that
subtitle: In criticising his government’s planning, a Nigerian journalist said nearly 80% of the country’s people don’t have access to potable – safe drinking – water. Is Nigeria’s water supply system really this poor?
author: africacheck.org

Journalist Dele Sobowale wrote in a column that close to 80% of Nigerians “lack potable water” – water that is safe for drinking.

The country’s 2016/17 multiple indicator cluster survey found that 90.8% of household members drank water contaminated to some degree by

bacteria, which may cause sickness.

In the contaminated water samples, 23% had low levels of bacteria, 16% medium levels, 15% high levels, and 46% very high levels – putting people at serious risk.

We therefore rate Sobowale’s claim as understated.
